data.title: Luajit
The App crashes when uploading image files
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13
- devices test on: hTC Desire 600
- developing environments
  - NDK version: android-ndk-r10d
  - Xcode version: V8.0
  - VS version:
  - brower type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Uploading image files to tomcat server.
2. The solution is to add "urlConnection.setChunkedStreamingMode(0);" to avoid out of memory at the function of "createHttpURLConnection" after the line of "urlConnection = (HttpURLConnection) url.openConnection();".

data.title: The App crashes when using HttpClient
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: cocos2d-x-3.13
- devices test on: hTC Desire 600
- developing environments
  - NDK version: android-ndk-r10d
  - Xcode version:
  - VS version:
  - brower type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  The app crashes at at line 716 of HttpClient-android.cpp, the app runs on hTC Desire600 and gets the data from a tomcat server. The root cause is that system got a nullptr of messageInfo when executing "strcpy(responseMessage, messageInfo);" 
2. It is better to check the pointer's address before executing strcpy.
   if (nullptr != messageInfo)
   {// To avoid crash in some mobile phone.
       strcpy(responseMessage, messageInfo);
       free(messageInfo);
   }

data.title: Minor fix for TextureCache::addImage(image, key).
data.body: - Removes insignificant log: `prevents overloading the autorelease pool`, it is copied from `cocos2d-iphone` here - Removes unused `retain -> autorelease` code - Checks the return value of `texture->initWithImage`, if it returns false, texture should be released and set to nullptr. - More specific log output in TextureCache::addImage(image, key) - Checks arguments validation for VolatileTextureMgr::addImage

data.title: Turn on recommended warnings for Xcode 8
data.body:
This PR just updates the Xcode settings to enable the recommended warnings for Xcode 8. It also works fine on Xcode 7.3.1 and keeps backward compatibility with Xcode 7+.

![screen shot 2016-09-17 at 17 50 14](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4461792/18856636/95bf9fde-8497-11e6-9542-a44a59e735be.png)

These compiler options will help us spot problems like the https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/16580. 
Thanks.

data.title: Cannot find module with tag 'android/cpufeatures/prebuilt-mk' - gen-libs
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13.1
- devices test on: 
- developing environments
  - NDK version: r12b
  - Xcode version:
  - VS version:
  - brower type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:
- cocos gen-libs -p android -m release
- update proj.android/build-cfg.json,  proj.android/jni/Android.mk
  according to android instruction
  http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/how-to-speed-up-cocos2d-x-build-with-prebuilt-lib/23402

proj.android/jni/Android.mk add:
`$(call import-add-path,$(LOCAL_PATH)/../../cocos2d/cocos/prebuilt-mk)`

proj.android/build-cfg.json add
`"../../../cocos/prebuilt-mk",`
- compile
  
  \tests\cpp-empty-test
  `call cocos deploy -m release -p android --ndk-mode release`
- Bug compilation fails:

> tests\cpp-empty-test\proj.android../../../cocos/prebuilt-mk/./Android.mk: Cannot find module with tag 'android/cpufeatures/prebuilt-mk' in import path

Comments:
cpufeatures was added lately to prebuilt-mk/./Android.mk

data.title: Win32: Third-party .dlls using different platform toolsets
data.body:
On win32, currently cocos2d-x and most .dlls use the setting for Platform Toolset v120_xp.

Some 3rd-party .dlls however use different platforms toolsets, namely v100 used by sqlite3 and v110 used by libmpg123, libogg, libvorbis, libvorbisfile and libopenal.

This adds the requirement to manually include msvcr100.dll and msvcr110.dll when distributing the .exe of a game. Ideally all .dlls would use v120_xp simplifying the distribution.

data.title: Mat4.decompose() mistake ?
data.body:
Hello I had some troubles with matrix decomposition (quaternion part) ...
I had a sprite transform i wanted to apply to another sprite using decomposition (without copying the nodeToWorldTransform directly).
Could'nt make it right so after many breakpoints and logs I ended up looking at the  Mat4.decompose() function

in this screen you can see the the wrongly oriented sprite over the sprite i want to get the transforms from :

![quatwrong](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1607568/18666461/432a5f86-7f2c-11e6-9c6a-c32804deaaee.PNG)

after some research i have found this 
https://d3cw3dd2w32x2b.cloudfront.net/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/matrix-to-quat.pdf

Ended spotting a difference in the implementation of cocos

cocos:
    if (trace > MATH_EPSILON)
    {
        float s = 0.5f / sqrt(trace);
        rotation->w = 0.25f / s;
        rotation->x = (yaxis.z - zaxis.y) \* s;
        rotation->y = (zaxis.x - xaxis.z) \* s;
        rotation->z = (xaxis.y - yaxis.x) \* s;
    }
    else

and in the doc I get         float s = 0.5f / sqrt(1.0f + trace);

so i modified the cocos implementation and I got this

![quatright](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1607568/18666571/d3028d9a-7f2c-11e6-918d-266697db9859.PNG)

which is what i was expecting from the function

So I think there's a problem in the Mat4::decompose() function .. or maybe i missed something

can you give me some feed back on this ?
thanks
- cocos2d-x version: cocos2d-x-3.11.1 May 27 2016
- devices test on: any
- developing environments
  - Xcode version: 7.3.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. just use the decomposition function of the Mat4 class
2. in some cases it gets quaternion rotation wrong

data.title: Fix implicit conversion warning
data.body:
Hello, I now get two warnings when building libcocos2d for Mac using Xcode 7.3.1. This fix tries to address the warnings.

```
cocos/platform/CCSAXParser.cpp:114:73: warning: implicit conversion loses integer precision: 'size_t' (aka 'unsigned long') to 'int' [-Wshorten-64-to-32]
        SAXParser::textHandler(_ccsaxParserImp, (const CC_XML_CHAR *)s, len);
        ~~~~~~~~~                                                       ^~~
cocos/platform/CCSAXParser.cpp:166:33: warning: implicit conversion loses integer precision: 'size_t' (aka 'unsigned long') to 'int' [-Wshorten-64-to-32]
        parser.parse<>(xmlData, dataLength);
        ~~~~~~                  ^~~~~~~~~~
```

data.title: Fixing issue where ScriptingCore::evalString would always return fals
data.body: e, and not evaluate the string, due to an improper null check.

data.title: Fix mismatched memory deallocators
data.body:
Valgrind also reports a mismatched memory deallocator when deallocating an experimental::TMXLayer:

```
==8331== Mismatched free() / delete / delete []
==8331==    at 0x4C2B1C6: operator delete(void*) (in /usr/lib/valgrind/vgpreload_memcheck-amd64-linux.so)
==8331==    by 0x15ABB44: cocos2d::experimental::TMXLayer::~TMXLayer() (CCFastTMXLayer.cpp:133)
```

Just like in pull request #16560, the memory which `_tiles` points to gets allocated on [CCTMXXMLParser.cpp:457](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/2d/CCTMXXMLParser.cpp#L457) using `malloc`, and therefore a `free` must be used.

Another mismatched memory deallocator was found by valgrind: 

```
==3357== Mismatched free() / delete / delete []
==3357==    at 0x4C2B1C6: operator delete(void*) (in /usr/lib/valgrind/vgpreload_memcheck-amd64-linux.so)
==3357==    by 0x199EDB9: spine::SkeletonRenderer::~SkeletonRenderer() (SkeletonRenderer.cpp:101)
```

In this last case, the memory `_worldVertices` points to gets allocated on [SkeletonRenderer.cpp#L64](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/editor-support/spine/SkeletonRenderer.cpp#L64). A `delete []` must be used in this case.

data.title: Remove extra semicolon after member function definition
data.body:
When using libcocos2d in my project with Xcode 8.0 and Clang at the highest warning level (e.g. `-Weverything`), I get the following warnings:

```
cocos/2d/CCFastTMXLayer.h:197:74: warning: extra ';' after member function definition [-Wextra-semi]
cocos/2d/CCFastTMXLayer.h:213:6: warning: extra ';' after member function definition [-Wextra-semi]
cocos/2d/CCFastTMXTiledMap.h:189:6: warning: extra ';' after member function definition [-Wextra-semi]
cocos/2d/CCFastTMXTiledMap.h:203:6: warning: extra ';' after member function definition [-Wextra-semi]
cocos/2d/CCTMXLayer.h:130:6: warning: extra ';' after member function definition [-Wextra-semi]
cocos/2d/CCTMXLayer.h:248:6: warning: extra ';' after member function definition [-Wextra-semi]
cocos/2d/CCTMXLayer.h:280:6: warning: extra ';' after member function definition [-Wextra-semi]
cocos/2d/CCTMXObjectGroup.h:114:6: warning: extra ';' after member function definition [-Wextra-semi]
cocos/2d/CCTMXObjectGroup.h:129:6: warning: extra ';' after member function definition [-Wextra-semi]
cocos/2d/CCTMXTiledMap.h:254:6: warning: extra ';' after member function definition [-Wextra-semi]
cocos/2d/CCTMXTiledMap.h:268:6: warning: extra ';' after member function definition [-Wextra-semi]
cocos/2d/CCTMXXMLParser.h:206:6: warning: extra ';' after member function definition [-Wextra-semi]
cocos/2d/CCTMXXMLParser.h:237:6: warning: extra ';' after member function definition [-Wextra-semi]
cocos/2d/CCTMXXMLParser.h:244:6: warning: extra ';' after member function definition [-Wextra-semi]
cocos/2d/CCTMXXMLParser.h:251:6: warning: extra ';' after member function definition [-Wextra-semi]
cocos/2d/CCTMXXMLParser.h:275:6: warning: extra ';' after member function definition [-Wextra-semi]
cocos/3d/CCTerrain.h:188:10: warning: extra ';' after member function definition [-Wextra-semi]
cocos/base/CCScheduler.h:450:6: warning: extra ';' after member function definition [-Wextra-semi]
cocos/base/CCScheduler.h:459:6: warning: extra ';' after member function definition [-Wextra-semi]
...
```

This PR removes some extra semicolons at the end of a function definition because those semicolons are superfluous in C++. Thanks!

data.title: iOS10 crash when minimize App and open it again
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.11
- devices test on: iPhone 6, iPad mini 4, iPad Air
- developing environments
  - NDK version:
  - Xcode version: 8
  - VS version:
  - brower type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open the App
2. touch iPhone/iPad Home, minimize it
3. waiting a few seconds
4. open the App again, then it crash

The same crash occurred when buying goods in the App. When I touch a piece of goods, it also crash after the price of goods appear.

tips: this situation doesn't appear in the iOS8 or iOS9

data.title: Fix _BSD_SOURCE deprecated warning
data.body:
To define `_BSD_SOURCE` macro is deprecated since glibc 2.20.

```
In file included from /usr/include/assert.h:35:0,
                 from /home/user/local/cocos2d-x/external/lua/lua/lapi.c:8:
/usr/include/features.h:148:3: warning: #warning "_BSD_SOURCE and _SVID_SOURCE are deprecated, use _DEFAULT_SOURCE" [-Wcpp]
 # warning "_BSD_SOURCE and _SVID_SOURCE are deprecated, use _DEFAULT_SOURCE"
   ^~~~~~~
```

According to the [man page](http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/feature_test_macros.7.html) `_BSD_SOURCE` section, to define both `_BSD_SOURCE` and `_DEFAULT_SOURCE` suppresses the warnings and keeps backward compatibility.
This PR adds it.
I compile cocos2d-x using Linux gcc 6.2.1 and glibc 2.24.

data.title: Fix -Wreturn-type warning on Linux clang
data.body:
This commit fixes the following warning on Linux clang 3.8.1

```
/home/user/local/cocos2d-x/cocos/audio/linux/AudioEngine-linux.cpp:221:1: warning: control may reach end of non-void function [-Wreturn-type]
}
^
```
